knimeNode.name: FilterSummary
knimeNode.shortDescription: Node for filtering and summarizing the results of the Loss-of-Function workflow

fullDescription.intro:
This node was especially developed for filtering and summarizing four VCF files produced by Pindel and GATK and annotated by VAT. It is the final node of the Loss-of-Function pipeline. It implements a coverage-based filter to reduce the number of false positive loss-of-function variants. Additionally it outputs three tables (with all variants, all loss-of-function variants and the filtered loss-of-function variants). It is possible to add annotations from NCBI gene_info ( http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov ), WikiPathways ( http://wikipathways.org/index.php/WikiPathways ) and Reactome ( http://www.reactome.org ) about the affected genes to these tables. For generation of plots the node produces a file with various counts concerning the loss-of-function mutations found in the files.
Predecessor Loss-of-Function nodes: VAT, VCFLoader
fullDescription.option: Set this filtering threshold according to the overall coverage. All variant sites that are covered by less reads are filtered out.
The fraction of reads that support the variant is another filter criteria. It excludes variants with less than a certain percentage (default 20 %) of the reads containing the variant.
If you tick this option, FilterSummary generates a file with counts of loss-of-function mutations. This file is useful to create plots.

option.name: Add original VCF info and sample column

fullDescription.option: Checking this options adds additional columns to the summary tables. The columns contain the original info and sample attributes of the VCF files.

option.name: Annotate OMIM IDs from gene_info file

fullDescription.option: This option adds a column with OMIM IDs to the output tables. Using this option you have to set the path to a NCBI gene_info file (it can be obtained at http://mirrors.vbi.vt.edu/mirrors/ftp.ncbi.nih.gov/gene/DATA/GENE_INFO/Mammalia/Homo_sapiens.gene_info.gz ).

This option adds a column with pathways to the output tables. Using this option you have to set the path to a WikiPathways file (it can be obtained at http://wikipathways.org/wpi/cache/wikipathways_data_Homo%20sapiens.tab ).

option.name: Annotate number of interactions from reactome

fullDescription.option: This option adds a column with the number of interactions to the output tables. Using this option you have to set the path to a Reactome file (it can be obtained at http://www.reactome.org/download/current/homo_sapiens.mitab.interactions.txt.gz ).
